thoughts.text: The output of the 'echo $PATH' command does not include the path to the Node.js binaries. This suggests that Node.js was not successfully added to the PATH. I'll need to find a way to add Node.js to the PATH that persists across shell sessions.
thoughts.reasoning: Adding Node.js to the PATH is necessary to use the 'node' and 'npm' commands. The 'export' command only adds Node.js to the PATH for the current shell session, which is why the 'npm' command is not found.
thoughts.plan:
- Find a way to add Node.js to the PATH that persists across shell sessions
- Add Node.js to PATH
- Configure npm
- Install NextJS
- Develop the frontend of the app
- Install other necessary libraries
- Start developing the rest of the app
thoughts.criticism: I should have verified if Node.js was in the PATH before attempting to configure npm. This would have saved time and avoided the error.
thoughts.speak: I'm going to find a way to add Node.js to the PATH that persists across shell sessions.
